lines.text: I see a monkey.
A what?
A monkey.
Well it doesn't surprise me a bit.If you don't quit drinking that brandy,you'll be seeing pink elephants.
Now I've an idea.
You've an idea?
I'll buy the whole business for five thousand cool.
Why for you're being so generous, we'll throw in our mule.
You can't do that, Ollie, don't be such a fool.
It's my idea!
It's a splendid idea.
It's just an idea of my own.
It's just an idea. A splendid idea. It's just an idea of my own.
[Stan harmonizes in a baritone voice]
I see a monkey.
That doesn't surprise me a bit
I thought you told me I had her in the palm of my hand.
Well you did, but you didn't play your cards right.

[hearing crickets]
The Cricket Song.
Cricket Song. That's not bad, sir, not bad at all.
